gui.table

Class AbstractTableImplementation

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.table.AbstractTableImplementation

  • public abstract class AbstractTableImplementation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles almost all the setup of a JTable that is sortable and can be rearranged, and reloads when data changes if it is attached as a listener to a data source. Only the abstract methods should need to be filled in by the subclass, and most of those should be one line at most. Subclasses may want to override the SimpleTableSorter with a custom one if they have more complex behavior than string sorting.
    Author:
    Daniel J. Rivers 2013 Created: Jan 31, 2013, 4:42:16 PM

        protected java.lang.Object[][] getSortedFilteredData()

      • createNewModel

        protected javax.swing.table.TableModel createNewModel()
        Goes through the columnNames returned by getColumnNames() and adds the data for each row according to the column names By default all cells are set to not editable. If a change in this behavior is desired, a new TableModel should be constructed using filterData( convertData() ) to get the data and getColumnNames() to get the column names.
        Returns:
        The constructed table model from the data and column names held by this table implementation

      • reconstruct

        protected void reconstruct()
        Fill the table with data.

      • reconstructHook

        protected void reconstructHook()
        can be used to do anything that needs to be done after the table has been reloaded as a new model Good examples of when to override this would be to set custom cell renderers for certain columns, or special spacing for columns

      • getIDFromDataObject

        protected java.lang.String getIDFromDataObject(java.lang.Object[] data)
        Determines a unique ID from a data Object. This is used to be able to tell which objects to reselect when the table reloads. Defaults as data.toString() Should be overridden when necessary (almost always if the data can change) to provide a more unique id match
        Parameters:
        data - Data object that a table row is constructed from
        Returns:
        a customized ID String to represent the data row - (data.toString()) is the default
